title: Helena Christensen displays her statuesque frame as she attends documentary screening in NYC
text:
She's one of the fashion industry's most celebrated models, having first risen to fame in the 1990s.

And Helena Christensen looked nothing short of sensational as she stepped out for a special screening of the documentary Serendipity in New York City on Tuesday.

The Danish beauty, 50, donned a black long-sleeved dress with a detailed multi-coloured floral print.

Style: Helena Christensen, 50, looked nothing short of sensational as she stepped out for a special screening of the documentary Serendipity in New York City on Tuesday

The garment also featured a high collar and a pleated detail while Helena added height to her frame with a pair of red heels.

Styling her brunette locks into an updo, the model completed her look for the evening with a pink clutch bag.

Helena kickstarted her career when she won the Miss Universe Denmark crown in 1986, representing her native country in Miss Universe later that year.

The cover girl later modelled for magazines including Vogue, Elle and Harper's Bazaar and she is also a former Victoria's Secret Angel.

Fashion: The Danish beauty donned a black long-sleeved dress with a detailed multi-coloured floral print

Her outing comes after Helena and her ex Norman Reedus, 50, took to Instagram to wish their son Mingus a happy 20th birthday.

Helena shared a snap of their lad towering over her and Norman on his graduation day, along with nine other photos of Mingus taken over the years.

She captioned the set: 'Today is a beautiful day because you were born, 20 years ago! Love you so much.'

Outfit: The garment also featured a high collar and a pleated detail while Helena added height to her frame with a pair of red heels (pictured with Serendipity director Prune Nourry)

Look: Styling her brunette locks into an updo, the model completed her look for the evening with a pink clutch bag

At 6ft tall, he outstrips his statuesque mom, a former model, and his actor dad, who both stand at 5ft 10ins.

'Happy birthday to the coolest of all time,' The Walking Dead star captioned his Instagram post, which featured four snaps of his son over the years.

Helena also commented on Norman’s post, writing: 'Our baby boy is a young man and I love him more than anything.'

Helena and Norman split up in 2003 after five years together but the amicable exes are often seen together supporting their son.
description: The Danish model, 50, looked nothing short of sensational as she stepped out for a special screening of the documentary Serendipity in New York City on Tuesday.
